channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêTC39 advances numerous proposals at latest meeting„ÄëTC39Âú®ÊúÄÊñ∞‰ºöËÆÆ‰∏äÊèêÂá∫‰∫ÜËÆ∏Â§öÂª∫ËÆÆ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã739 ‚Äî June 6, 2025

Read on the Web

üñäÔ∏è I was meant to be traveling this week. My plans changed, but I‚Äôd planned for a shorter issue, so enjoy the bitesize take! Back to full service next week.¬†:-)
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

JavaScript Weekly

‚ö°¬†Announcing Rolldown-Vite ‚Äî Rolldown is a fast Rust-based JavaScript bundler designed to eventually be used by the equally fast Vite build tool - now it‚Äôs a reality. It‚Äôs a drop-in replacement too, and early adopters are reporting huge build time reductions. Try it now before it becomes the¬†default.

Evan You

TC39 Advances Several Proposals at Latest Meeting ‚Äî Coverage of what happened at last week‚Äôs meeting of the folks working on the ECMAScript spec whose decisions influence what becomes everyday JavaScript (eventually). Array.fromAsync, Error.isError, and explicit resource management all move to stage¬†4, among other¬†things.

Sarah Gooding

CodeRabbit‚Äôs Free AI Code Reviews in IDE - VS Code, Cursor, Windsurf ‚Äî Code Rabbit brings AI code reviews to VS Code, Cursor & Windsurf. Get line-by-line reviews, one-click fixes & codebase-aware feedback - all free in your IDE. Seamlessly integrates with git workflows. Install the extension & start¬†reviewing!

CodeRabbit sponsor

WebStatus.dev: Now with More Data, Deeper Insights, and a Clearer Path to Baseline ‚Äî Google's Web Platform Status site lets us query and track various web platform features and the browsers that support them. It‚Äôs had a big update¬†recently.

Kadir Topal (Google)

IN BRIEF:

  • The React Native team has frozen the legacy architecture codebase in order to focus solely on the New Architecture going¬†forward.

  • SQLite-JS is an interesting SQLite extension that adds the ability to write custom SQLite functions using JavaScript.

  • The State of CSS 2025 survey is now open to¬†take.

RELEASES:

  • Babel 8 Beta ‚Äì Follows on two years from the alpha, but "All the breaking changes we were planning to include in Babel 8 are done".

  • ESLint v9.28.0 ‚Äì The popular linter adds more TypeScript syntax support to core¬†rules.

  • AngularFire 20.0 ‚Äì Integrate Firebase into Angular apps. Now supporting the new Angular¬†20 released last¬†week.

  • Vitest 3.2, Astro 5.9, Ionic 8.6, Prisma 6.9.0

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

A JavaScript Developer's Guide to Go ‚Äî Go is a popular, fast language most commonly used for backend work, and this is a good primer targeted at JavaScript developers keen to learn more about¬†it.

Prateek Surana

üí° If you get into Go, we also publish Go Weekly, a newsletter just like JavaScript Weekly but for Go developers¬†:-)

document.currentScript is More Useful Than I Thought ‚Äî ‚ÄúEvery so often, I stumble across a well-established JavaScript API in the browser that I probably should‚Äôve known about years¬†ago.‚Äù

Alex MacArthur

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Talks from Svelte Summit Spring 2025 ‚Äî The Svelte team recently promised to release the talk videos from its recent Svelte Summit event, and there are already 12 to enjoy here. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†What Svelte Promises by Rich Harris, Svelte‚Äôs creator, is the obvious entry¬†point.

Svelte Society

üí° If videos aren't your thing, the Svelte team has also published a monthly update of what's new in Svelte, as of June¬†2025.

üìÑ Write More Reliable JavaScript with Optional Chaining ‚Äì It might?.be?.a?.good?.idea Matt Smith

üìÑ How Imports Work in React Server Components Dan Abramov

üìÑ Intercepting Network Requests in Chrome Extensions rxliuli

üìÑ The Ingredients of a Productive Monorepo Sean Gillespie

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

php-node: A Way to Seamlessly Bring PHP to Node.js ‚Äî A neat idea, even if you don‚Äôt like PHP. It‚Äôs a native module for Node that lets you run PHP apps within the Node environment. Why? For migrating legacy apps, building hybrid PHP/JS apps, or Node apps that simply need to call out to PHP for some reason (WordPress, maybe, as shown¬†here).

Matteo Collina et al.

Learn How to Monetize Your SaaS with Clerk Billing ‚Äî Clerk Billing makes SaaS subscriptions easy ‚Äî no custom UI, no webhooks. Learn how to set it up in this¬†guide.

Clerk sponsor

Storybook 9: The UI Component Workshop ‚Äî The popular one-stop tool for working on, and testing, frontend UI components gets a big update in terms of testing. Storybook Test offers interaction, visual, and accessibility testing, complete with a ‚Äòwatch mode‚Äô for testing whenever you save, whether you‚Äôre working with React, Svelte, Next.js, React Native, and¬†more.

Michael Shilman

üèñÔ∏è¬†Beachpatrol: A CLI Tool to Automate Your Everyday Web Browser ‚Äî A higher level way to use Playwright on macOS or Linux to control a regular non-headless browser instance. It‚Äôs essentially an approach where you still want a visible browser you can use in a normal way but with added automation¬†possibilities.

Sebastian Carlos

  • Starry Night 3.8 ‚Äì GitHub-like syntax highlighting.

  • ngx-vflow 1.9 ‚Äì Add node-based interfaces to Angular¬†apps.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

document.currentscript ÊØîÊàëÊÉ≥Ë±°ÁöÑÊõ¥ÊúâÁî® - ‚ÄúÊØèÈöî‰∏ÄÊÆµÊó∂Èó¥ÔºåÊàëÂÅ∂ÁÑ∂ÂèëÁé∞‰∫ÜÊàëÂèØËÉΩÂá†Âπ¥ÂâçÂ∞±Â∫îËØ•Áü•ÈÅìÁöÑÊµèËßàÂô®‰∏≠Âª∫Á´ã‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÆåÂñÑÁöÑJavaScript API„ÄÇ

Alex MacArthur

<Ë∑®Â∫¶style =‚Äú font-weightÔºö600; font-sizeÔºö1.1em; colorÔºöÔºÉ000;‚Äú>‚ñ∂ - ÊâøËØ∫Â∞Ü‰ªéÂÖ∂ÊúÄËøëÁöÑ Svelte SummitÊ¥ªÂä®‰∏≠ÂèëÂ∏ÉË∞àËØùËßÜÈ¢ëÊ¥ªÂä®ÔºåËøôÈáåÂ∑≤ÁªèÊúâ12‰∏™ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫´Âèó„ÄÇ ‚ñ∂chÔÉò

Svelte Society

üí°Â¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÊòØÊÇ®ÁöÑËßÜÈ¢ëÔºåÈÇ£‰πàSvelteÂõ¢ÈòüËøòÂèëÂ∏É‰∫Ü

üìÑ

item.title: „ÄêA timeline of JavaScript's history„ÄëJavaScriptÂéÜÂè≤ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥Ë°®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã737 ‚Äî May 23, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Brief History of JavaScript ‚Äî JavaScript (originally named LiveScript) turns thirty years old this year and the Deno team has put together a fantastic timeline-based tour of how much things have progressed from its first appearance in Netscape Navigator, through offshoots like JScript, standardization, and the introduction of Node.js, all the way through to the modern¬†day.

The Deno Team

2x-40x Faster Docker Builds with Blacksmith ‚Äî With a one-line code change, Blacksmith can make your Docker builds incremental by mounting your Docker layer cache into your GitHub Actions runner. Blacksmith is used by 600+ companies like Ashby, Clerk, and¬†Mintlify.

Blacksmith sponsor

‚ö°¬†Announcing TypeScript Native Previews ‚Äî Earlier this year, Anders Hejlsberg teased a 10x faster TypeScript through efforts being made to port the TypeScript compiler to Go, enabling it to be compiled and run natively, as well as take advantage of more concurrency. The good news is you can now give it a.. go for¬†yourself.

Microsoft

‚ñ∂¬†¬†An Introduction to JavaScript Frameworks ‚Äî The creator of SolidJS has put together a tight 11-minute video boiling down the different approaches taken by React, Angular, Vue, Svelte, and Solid. Dense, but a great way to get a lay of the¬†land.

Ryan Carniato

IN BRIEF:

  • Ryan Dahl responds to recent community chatter about the state of the Deno project in 'Reports of Deno's Demise Have Been Greatly Exaggerated'.

  • Guess the Output is a fun multi-choice JavaScript quiz to put your knowledge to the test. Each answer is explained as you¬†go.

  • A look at the agenda for next week's TC39 meeting, including the proposals up for¬†discussion.

  • React Router now has preview support for React Server Components.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v24.1.0 (Current) and v22.16.0 (LTS)

  • Bun v1.2.14 ‚Äì The fast JS runtime &¬†toolkit.

  • Slonik v48 ‚Äì Node.js Postgres client with runtime & build time type¬†safety.

  • Zod v4, Astro 5.8, ESLint v9.27.0

üìñ¬† Articles

‚ñ∂¬†¬†What's New in Angular ‚Äî Two members of the Angular team presented a session at this week‚Äôs Google I/O event on the latest updates to the Angular framework in anticipation of the eventual release of Angular 20 next¬†Thursday.

Chasanoff and Thompson (Google)

ESLint v9.0: A Retrospective ‚Äî It‚Äôs been a year since ESLint v9.0 landed as the first major release in a few years. It enabled the new flat-config system by default and the rollout didn‚Äôt go as smoothly as hoped. This retrospective breaks down the full story and shares the lessons¬†learned.

Nicholas C. Zakas

Getting Started with Clerk Billing ‚Äî Learn how to build a complete billing experience with Clerk and Stripe, no custom UI or webhooks¬†required.

Clerk sponsor

Six Ways Slack, Notion, and VS Code Improved Electron App Performance ‚Äî An experienced Electron app developer shares a guide to Electron performance optimization and how to get the most out of your¬†apps.

Amila Welihinda

üìÑ How the at() Method Makes Array Indexing Easier Matt Smith

üìÑ Styling Console Text in Node.js Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

üìÑ Authenticating JavaScript WebSockets Steven Waterman

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Defuddle: Extract the Main Content from Web Pages ‚Äî Strips extraneous clutter from HTML in order to leave only the primary content for you to format or use as you wish. Essentially a modern implementation of the ideas behind Mozilla‚Äôs Readability. There‚Äôs an online demo if you want to give it a¬†try.

Steph Ango

snapDOM: Captures DOM Nodes as Images ‚Äî A fast and accurate DOM-to-image capture mechanism to capture any HTML element as a scalable SVG image, preserving styles, fonts, background images, etc.

ZumerLab

AI-Powered Code Reviews for JavaScript Teams ‚Äî CodeRabbit helps you ship cleaner JavaScript by reviewing every PR with AI that understands your¬†codebase.

CodeRabbit sponsor

ForesightJS: Predictive Mouse Intent Library ‚Äî An interesting concept, with the entire page acting as a demo of sorts. The idea is to decrease latency by prefetching data or pages as soon as you think a user might be heading in that direction. Your mileage may vary and it‚Äôs less useful for touch¬†devices.

ForesightJS, Inc.

Astra: A New JavaScript-to-EXE Compiler for Windows ‚Äî Boasts ‚Äúa new approach to compiling‚Äù JavaScript applications for a single executable experience on Windows only (for¬†now).

QwertyCodeQC

Crosspost: A JS Utility for Posting Across Multiple Social Networks ‚Äî Currently supports eight different services including Bluesky, X, Mastodon, and¬†LinkedIn.

Nicholas C. Zakas

Rockpack 6.0: An Alternative React App Starter ‚Äî A tool aiming to get React project setup time as low as possible, complete with server side rendering support, bundling, linting and testing. v6.0 updates everything for React 19. GitHub¬†repo.

Alex Sergey

  • üóìÔ∏è Calendar Link 2.10.0 ‚Äì Generate event links for popular calendar¬†services.

  • octokit.js 5.0 ‚Äì 'All-batteries-included' GitHub SDK for JavaScript.

  • image-type 6.0 ‚Äì Detect the image type of a Buffer/Uint8Array.

  • Peggy 5.0 ‚Äì Parser generator for¬†JavaScript.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

Build a professional design system in less than a day, using Hope AI, new model by Bit.Cloud. Enjoy reusable UI components ready for¬†import.

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem this week:

  • Google's I/O event took place this week and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†its 'developer keynote' was a highlight, particularly when Addy Osmani showed off some of the latest Chrome DevTools fun (starting at about 30 minutes in).

  • Microsoft has unveiled a new Postgres extension for VS Code that brings IntelliSense completion to SQL, GitHub Copilot integration, a visual way to explore your schemas, and¬†more.

  • ü§ñ Anthropic has unveiled its new Claude 4 models. The Claude family of LLMs are quite heavily used by modern coding agents, as well as Claude's own now-generally-available Claude Code tool.

  • The Glitch platform, a popular way to build and host Node-backed webapps, is shutting down its app hosting functionality ‚Äì it seems uncertain quite what Glitch will or won't be after¬†July.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

üìñarticles

‚ñ∂ - AngularÂõ¢ÈòüÁöÑ‰∏§ÂêçÊàêÂëòÂú®Êú¨Âë®ÁöÑGoogle I/OÊ¥ªÂä®‰∏ä‰ªãÁªç‰∫ÜAngular FrameworkÁöÑÊúÄÊñ∞Êõ¥Êñ∞Ôºå‰ª•ÊúüÊúÄÁªàÂèëÂ∏ÉAngular 20‰∏ãÂë®Âõõ„ÄÇ

ChasanoffÂíåThompsonÔºàGoogleÔºâ

- Ëá™Eslint V9.0ÁôªÈôÜ‰ª•Êù•Â∑≤ÁªèÊòØÂá†Âπ¥Êù•ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏ªË¶ÅÁâàÊú¨Â∑≤Áªè‰∏ÄÂπ¥‰∫Ü„ÄÇÈªòËÆ§ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÂÆÉÂêØÁî®‰∫ÜÊñ∞ÁöÑFlat-ConfigÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊé®Âá∫Âπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÂÉèÂ∏åÊúõÁöÑÈÇ£Ê†∑È°∫Âà©ËøõË°å„ÄÇËøôÁßçÂõûÈ°æÊÄßÊâìÁ†¥‰∫ÜÊï¥‰∏™ÊïÖ‰∫ãÂπ∂ÂàÜ‰∫´‰∫ÜÁªèÈ™åÊïôËÆ≠„ÄÇ

Nicholas C. Zakas

- Â≠¶‰π†Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî®ÊñáÂëòÂíåÊù°Á∫πÂª∫Á´ãÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑËÆ°Ë¥π‰ΩìÈ™åÔºåÊó†ÈúÄËá™ÂÆö‰πâUIÊàñWebhooks„ÄÇ

Â∫óÂëò

<Ë∑®Â∫¶Ê†∑Âºè=‚Äú font-weightÔºö600; font-sizeÔºö1.1em; colorÔºöÔºÉ000;‚Äú> - ÁªèÈ™å‰∏∞ÂØåÁöÑÁîµÂ≠êÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÂàÜ‰∫´‰∫ÜÁîµÂ≠êÊÄßËÉΩ‰ºòÂåñÊåáÂçó‰ª•ÂèäÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰ªéÂ∫îÁî®‰∏≠Ëé∑ÂæóÊúÄÂ§ßÊî∂Áõä„ÄÇ

Amila Welihinda

üìÑüìÑ

üìÑ

üëÄÂÖ∂‰ªñÂú∞Êñπ..

ËøôÊòØÊú¨Âë®Êõ¥ÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰∏úË•øÔºö

  • GoogleÁöÑ‚ñ∂qus'ÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫Âëò‰∏ªÈ¢òÊºîËÆ≤'ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∫ÆÁÇπÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØÂΩìAddy OsmaniÂ±ïÁ§∫‰∏Ä‰∫õÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑChrome DevTools Fun Êó∂Ôºà‰ªéÂ§ßÁ∫¶30ÂàÜÈíüÂºÄÂßãÔºâ„ÄÇ

  • MicrosoftÂ∑≤ÂÖ¨Â∏É

  • ü§ñÊãü‰∫∫ÂåñÂÖ∑ÊúâClaude Code tool.

  • glitch Âπ≥Âè∞ÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊûÑÂª∫Âíå‰∏ªÊú∫ËäÇÁÇπÊîØÊåÅÁöÑÁΩëÁªúÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÊµÅË°åÊñπÂºèÔºåÊòØ

item.title: „ÄêEverybody's gone lintin'„ÄëÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÈÉΩËµ∞‰∫Ü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã740 ‚Äî June 13, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The State of React and the Community in 2025 ‚Äî React continues to be a major dependency in the JavaScript world but recent innovations have led to much discussion about how it should move forward. Redux maintainer Mark Erikson gives an overview of React‚Äôs development over time, what led to some of its innovations, and dispels some ‚ÄòFUD and confusion‚Äô about where it's¬†headed.

Mark Erikson

üí° While we cover the biggest React stories in JavaScript Weekly, React Status is our weekly newsletter dedicated to React, so check it out for more¬†depth.

How Notion Cut Typing Latency By 15% ‚Äî Stop guessing why your web app is slow. Palette‚Äôs production JS profiler tells you why, down to the line of code. Get started for free¬†today.

Palette sponsor

Announcing Oxlint 1.0: The Super Fast Linter ‚Äî First appearing just 18 months ago, Oxlint has made an impact by being an incredibly fast Rust-powered linter for JavaScript and TypeScript, boasting a 50~100x performance improvement over ESLint while still having support for hundreds of its rules. Now, it‚Äôs gone¬†stable.

Boshen Chen and Cameron Clark

pnpm 10.12 Introduces an Experimental Global Virtual Store ‚Äî pnpm has long been prized for its speed and efficiency over npm. v10.12 takes things further introducing a ‚Äòglobal virtual store‚Äô that node_modules symlinks to, enabling projects to share dependencies without them being installed numerous¬†times.

Sarah Gooding (Socket)

IN BRIEF:

  • Surfin' Safari? Apple's WWDC25 event this week saw numerous developments that aren't 'liquid glass' related, including a look at what's new in Safari 26 (beta) including support for pattern modifiers in RegExp objects.

  • A writeup of a vulnerability found in OpenPGP.js.

  • Matteo Collina gives us a public service announcement around the end-of-life of some recent Node.js versions and some tips on upgrading to v22.

  • Gleam is an easy to read/write language targeting both Erlang and JS runtimes. The big news is that Gleam compiled to JS is now 30%¬†faster.

RELEASES:

  • H3 v2 Beta¬†‚Äì Cross-runtime Web standards focused HTTP server¬†framework.

  • Node.js v24.2 (Current) ‚Äì import.meta.main is a new boolean value available in ES modules that tells you if the current module was the entry point of the current process.

  • Visual Studio Code May 2025 ‚Äì Big enhancements to MCP support, but VS Code extensions can now also use ES¬†modules.

  • Deno 2.3.6, Rollup v4.43, Jasmine 5.8, Vue DevTools v7 for Firefox

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

Suppressions of Suppressions ‚Äî If you‚Äôre using a linter to keep your code clean, you may have silenced rules that feel too strict or irrelevant. But those suppressions can bury serious bugs. Dan Abramov argues for adding a rule to forbid disabling your most critical¬†checks.

Dan Abramov

How JavaScript Was Written Back in the Day ‚Äî It‚Äôs not the earliest JavaScript, but Trevor looks back at code written in the 2006-2015 pre-ES6¬†era.

Trevor I. Lasn

The Only Test Runner Fully Integrated with AI Agents ‚Äî Wallaby upgrades your AI agent to an expert debugging partner with runtime data, coverage, execution paths, runtime dependencies and real-time¬†insights.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Native Hot Module Reloading in Node via Module Hooks ‚Äî A clever use of module hooks to implement ‚Äòhot module‚Äô functionality natively and efficiently.

Immaculata

üì∫ Don't Use JSON.parse & JSON.stringify ‚Äì Jack points out some of these functions‚Äô shortcomings and possible¬†workarounds. Jack Herrington

üìÑ How ESLint Language Plugins Enhance DSL Usability Nicholas C. Zakas

üìÑ Things to Avoid in JavaScript ‚Äì A reminder of some¬†basics. Suren Enfiajyan

üìÑ Angular 20 Might Seem Boring ‚Äî 6 Reasons It‚Äôs Not Yan Sun

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

npmgraph: A Tool to Visualize npm Module Dependencies ‚Äî Give this Web-based tool one or more npm package names (or even your package.json file) and you can see a visualization of the dependency graphs for those packages, including where they intersect. Packages can be colored by various criteria (such as number of maintainers) and you can download SVGs of the¬†graphs.

Kieffer, Brigante, et al.

Jest 30: Faster, Leaner, and Better JS Testing ‚Äî A ‚Äònoticeably faster‚Äô release of this popular testing framework, adding improved ESM and TypeScript support, performance improvements and more. Upgrade docs¬†here.

Zaytsev & Nakazawa

Sync Clerk User Data to Supabase in Real Time with Webhooks ‚Äî Stop polling and start syncing. This guide shows how to stream Clerk user updates into Supabase with¬†ease.

Clerk sponsor

üçä¬†Orange ORM: An Active Record ORM for JavaScript and TypeScript ‚Äî A powerful ORM for Node, Bun and Deno, supporting both TypeScript and JavaScript, and both CommonJS and ESM. It follows an Active Record-style querying approach, is well documented, and certainly worth a look if working with most of the popular SQL¬†databases.

Lars-Erik Roald

Vue Equipment: A Toolkit for Nuxt and Vue.js ‚Äî A collection of ready-to-use plugins and composables for building modern web apps with both Vue and Nuxt. Explained¬†here.

Magic as a Service

üåì¬†DarkModeJS 2.0: A Utility Package for Managing Dark Mode ‚Äî Uses the matchMedia API and the prefers-color-scheme media query to fire functions whenever a user is in dark mode (or changes the¬†mode).

Assortment

üïπÔ∏è¬†Odyc.js: A JS Library for Pixel Games/Stories ‚Äî Has a bit of a 8-bit Game Boy Color vibe to it. You can create games, and try some examples, in this online¬†playground.

Charles Cailleteau

  • ü§ñ Midscene.js 0.18 ‚Äì Let AI and JavaScript be your browser¬†operator.

  • Acorn 8.15 ‚Äì Small, fast, JavaScript-based JavaScript¬†parser.

  • xo 1.1 ‚Äì Opinionated but configurable ESLint wrapper.

  • Mocha 11.6 ‚Äì Test framework for Node &¬†browsers.

  • JsBarcode 3.12 ‚Äì Barcode generation¬†library.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

"Change is just a merge away" - ‚ú® Automate code reviews with Infinitcode¬†AI:¬†Try¬†free¬†now.

üéπ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trial¬†available.

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üëÄ¬† Fun, fun, fun..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem this week:

  • The billionth repo on GitHub (be warned, it has a mildly NSFW name) has just been created to much¬†celebration.

  • Shopify explains its work on making import maps easier to use, including work on shims, the HTML spec, and encouraging browser developers to implement¬†improvements.

  • GitHub's remote MCP server is now in public preview. It enables AI agents and tools to access live GitHub context and work with various concepts like issues and pull¬†requests.

  • You may recall the TypeScript team is porting the TypeScript compiler to Go to take advantage of both native compilation speedups and Go's concurrency features. John Reilly and Ashley Claymore explain why Go is a 'pragmatic choice' for this project.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

È¢úËâ≤ÔºöÔºÉ3366aa;‚Äú>Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

üìñÊñáÁ´†ÂíåËßÜÈ¢ë

item.title: „ÄêHow Remix is shaking things up„ÄëÊ∑∑Èü≥Â¶Ç‰ΩïÊëáÂä®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã738 ‚Äî May 30, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Wake Up, Remix! Everything's Changing.. ‚Äî Big news from the Remix camp this week. About a year ago, Remix and React Router merged together reflecting their shared goals and code, but now it‚Äôs all change again. React Router is now basically what Remix originally intended to be, and so ‚ÄòRemix‚Äô is rebooting as a model-first, low-dependency, Web API-centric full-stack framework built on Preact. It‚Äôll no longer be a 'React framework' per¬†se.

Michael Jackson and Ryan Florence

üïí¬†The Upcoming Temporal API and What Problems It Will Solve ‚Äî The Temporal API has been cooking for many years now as a new way to work with dates and times in JavaScript. It‚Äôs just been enabled in Firefox 139 by default and sure to come to more runtimes ASAP. Here‚Äôs why it matters and what it¬†offers.

Suren Enfiajyan

CodeRabbit‚Äôs Free AI Code Reviews in IDE - VS Code, Cursor, Windsurf ‚Äî Code Rabbit brings AI code reviews to VS Code, Cursor & Windsurf. Get line-by-line reviews, one-click fixes & codebase-aware feedback - all free in your IDE. Seamlessly integrates with git workflows. Install the extension & start¬†reviewing!

CodeRabbit sponsor

Announcing Angular v20 ‚Äî A big release for the Google backed framework where a lot of the more recent experimental features (like signals and incremental hydration) have received a lot of polish and been promoted as stable. There are new experimental APIs too, including resource streaming and httpResource for making HTTP requests with a signal-based reactive¬†API.

Minko Gechev

üí° While the official release post (above) is packed with content, you might appreciate this brief magic-themed roundup of what's new in Angular¬†20.

IN BRIEF:

  • Matteo Collina has unveiled php-node, a way to run PHP apps within the same process as Node.js. Run WordPress with a Next.js frontend?¬†Sure.

  • TC39's 108th meeting is currently taking place with many proposals being advanced, such as Seeded Pseudo-Random Numbers moving to stage 2 and Error.isError moving to stage¬†4.

  • The OpenJS Foundation is now a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) for over 40 popular JavaScript projects it hosts, including ESLint, Express, and¬†Electron.

  • Node's technical steering committee has decided against instituting an official bounty program.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.2.15 ‚Äì Gains a bun audit tool for performing security audits of project¬†dependencies.

  • Ink 6.0 ‚Äì Use React to build CLI¬†apps. Now supporting React¬†19.

  • Docusaurus v3.8 ‚Äì Popular docs-oriented static site generator.

  • Ember 6.4, JSPM 4.0

üìñ¬† Articles

Why Are 2025/05/28 and 2025-05-28 Different Days in JavaScript? ‚Äî An interesting ‚ÄòWat‚Äô-like moment in just the first few lines of this post, which Brandon decided to dig into and¬†explain.

Brandon Dong

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Modern Performance Debugging in Chrome DevTools ‚Äî Paul shares a look at the reimagined Chrome DevTools Performance panel, showing off new features, how they work, and how to use them to make performance¬†gains.

Paul Irish

Build an LMS SaaS App from Scratch ‚Äî Learn to build a production-ready AI SaaS using Next.js with auth, billing, and an AI voice¬†agent.

Clerk sponsor

React, Visualized: A Visual Exploration of React Concepts ‚Äî The creators of a React course have updated their popular visual explainer of numerous core React concepts to cover React 19 and features like actions, transitions, and Server Components¬†too.

Tyler McGinnis et al.

‚ñ∂¬†¬†The 3 Ways JavaScript Frameworks Render the DOM ‚Äî The creator of the SolidJS framework looks at the different approaches frameworks take to render what they produce. A good look under the hood that isn‚Äôt too complex. (16¬†minutes.)

Ryan Carniato

Build a Blog with Angular in Under 30 Minutes Using Analog ‚Äî Analog is a meta-framework for Angular (think along the lines of Next.js or¬†Nuxt).

Peter Mbanugo

Your React Meta-Framework Feels Broken, Here's Why ‚Äî ‚ÄúSometimes you‚Äôve got to burn it all down, start from ash, and rebuild from first principles. This is what we did with¬†RedwoodSDK.‚Äù

Redwood Team

üìÑ No Server, No Database: Smarter Related Posts in Astro with Transformers.js Alexander Opalic

üìÑ A Thought on JavaScript 'Proof of Work' Anti-Scraper Systems Chris Siebenmann

üìÑ Multithreading in JavaScript with Web Workers Badmus Kola

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Svelte Flow 1.0: Create Node-Based UIs and Diagrams in Svelte ‚Äî From the creators of the similar React Flow comes a customizable Svelte component for building node-based editors and interactive diagrams. Want¬†examples?

webkid GmbH

Cap: A Lightweight, Modern Open Source CAPTCHA Alternative ‚Äî This solution boasts a method called ‚Äúproof-of-work‚Äù which attempts to make automated CAPTCHA solving more expensive. It uses a Web Component and you can try out a few demos here. GitHub¬†repo.

Cap

Enterprise Requirements Slowing You Down? There‚Äôs a Better Way ‚Äî WorkOS lets devs ship SSO, SCIM, audit logs & more‚Äîfast. Trusted by industry-leading teams like OpenAI, Vercel &¬†Plaid.

WorkOS sponsor

Google Gen AI SDK for TypeScript and JavaScript v1 ‚Äî Why let Python developers have all the fun? Now you can harness the full power of Google‚Äôs Gemini API (and Vertex platform) from Node.js¬†too.

Google

ReactJust: Server Components Without a Framework ‚Äî If, for some reason, you don‚Äôt want to adopt a full-scale framework like Next.js or React Router to use or experiment with RSCs, this ‚Äòvanilla RSC‚Äô approach could be of¬†interest.

almadoro

  • NeutralinoJS 6.1 ‚Äì Lightweight cross-platform desktop app¬†framework.

  • Linkify 4.3 ‚Äì Turn links, hashtags, and mentions in text to HTML¬†links.

  • image-type 6.0 ‚Äì Detect the image type of a Buffer/Uint8Array.

  • Faker 9.8 ‚Äì Generate fabricated data to your heart's¬†content.

  • file-type 21.0 ‚Äì Detect the file type of a file, stream, or¬†data.

  • Mineflayer 4.29 ‚Äì Create Minecraft bots in¬†JavaScript.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

How Notion‚Äôs engineering team tackled viral user growth to run PostgreSQL at scale on Amazon RDS with¬†pganalyze.

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem this week:

  • The annual Stack Overflow Developer Survey is back for a fifteenth¬†year.

  • A Minecraft-style building experience in pure CSS ‚Äì no JavaScript at¬†all!

  • Simon Willison writes about how GitHub Issues works really well as a personal notebook for taking notes, linking them together, and generally organizing whatever sort of information you want. It doesn't have to just be for code¬†projects.

  • I just discovered that Matthias Bynens, who you might know for his work on everything V8, ECMAScript specs, and more, keeps a repo of the 'smallest possible syntactically valid files' in many different¬†formats.

  • Did you know you can style alt text like any other text on Web¬†pages?

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª
